Package edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff

Class EditableTextLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff.TextLine
      • edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff.EditableTextLine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Editable
    public class EditableTextLine
extends TextLine
implements Editable
    Implements the methods provided by Editable and retains the attributes and actions of its superclass, TextLine.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff.TextLine

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EditableTextLine()
      Constructs an empty EditableTextLine.
      EditableTextLine​(java.lang.String line)
      Constructs an EditableTextLine object initialized to contain the same characters as in the argument string line.

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Appends the given string fragment at the end of TextLine

      Inserts the given string fragment at the specificed index position of a TextLine.
      void replace​(int start, int end, java.lang.String fragment)
      Replaces the characters between start (inclusive) and end (exclusive, i.e characters up to index end-1 are to be replaced) in this TextLine with characters in the specified fragment.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public void append​(java.lang.String fragment)
        Appends the given string fragment at the end of TextLine
        Specified by:
        append in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        fragment - - substring appended to the end of line

      • insert

        public void insert​(int index,
                   java.lang.String fragment)
            throws TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Inserts the given string fragment at the specificed index position of a TextLine. It is legal to insert at the end of a TextLine (index value given as lenght(). It is equivalent to appending to a TextLine.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        index - - position of fragment
        fragment - - substring of line
        Throws:
        TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the supplied index is out of bounds of a TextLine (0 to length().

      • replace

        public void replace​(int start,
                    int end,
                    java.lang.String fragment)
             throws TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Replaces the characters between start (inclusive) and end (exclusive, i.e characters up to index end-1 are to be replaced) in this TextLine with characters in the specified fragment.
        Specified by:
        replace in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        start - - the start of the string to be replaced
        end - - the end of the string to be replaced
        fragment - - substring of line
        Throws:
        TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the supplied start or end index is out of bounds of this TextLine (0 to length()), or if start greather than end
